III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an ISEP violation. Please note
that there are additional ISEP requirements that may not be included
in section 1.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract violation. Please note
that there are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS
Contract/Policy requirements except for the following:
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was not offered technical assistance:
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
It is suggested and best practice to update the foster parent/agency agreement
annually if the bed is still borrowed.
It is suggested that the agency adhere to the policy regarding members who should
be invited to FTM’s. It’s best practice to invite other workers, guardian ad litem etc.
when conducting an FTM.
EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
There were no incidents of substantiated child abuse and/or neglect during this
licensing period.
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plans not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
The agency submitted a corrective action plan for the eleven violations they received
on their last interim inspection dated 09/18/2018. The violations were as follows:
R400.12212 Personnel records, R400.12324 Reevaluation, R400.12325 License
recommendation, R400.12327 Special evaluation, R400.12403 Policy and procedure,
R400.12418 Development of service plans, ISEP 6.23(b) - Page 25 - 6.23 Caseload,
Supervisors (Commitment 59), ISEP 6.18 - Page 23 - Relative Foster Parent
Licensing, Timeliness, DHHS Policy FOM 722-06H - Page 5 - Caseworker Contact
4

Child in out-of-home placement and DHHS Policy FOM 722-06H – Page 7 -–
Unannounced Home Visit. There are no repeat violations which is an indication that
the agency has implemented successful corrective action plan for the previous
violations and is working to maintain compliance.
The DCWL Field Analyst report noted no safety alerts and no service related
Concerns for this report period.
VI. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or ISEP requirements and/or contract and policy. It is
recommended that the Growing Hope Through Love be issued a renewal of their
regular license.
